thread.title: This 'Speed Sisters' Documentary Will Totally Inspire You
thread.title_full: This 'Speed Sisters' Documentary Will Totally Inspire You

title: This 'Speed Sisters' Documentary Will Totally Inspire You
text: February 10, 2017 Courtesy of Betty Saadeh I’ve been gloomy since Trump initiated a series of terrifying executive orders , but after watching a screening of the Speed Sisters documentary recently, I felt totally re-energized. This fearless, firestorm of a doc awoke the revolutionary spirit in me, plus I hadn’t cried and laughed that many times in one sitting since watching the 2004 classic, White Chicks . The Speed Sisters claim to be the first female racing team in the Middle East, and they are just irreverent and DGAF. Their passion for cars breathes life into their supportive village of family and friends. You May Also Like Lifestyle What It's Really Like to Get Your Nipples Pierced With military checkpoints around every West Bank corner, every act is one of resistance and persistence. When the Speed Sisters walk, dress and paint their nails, they ooze bravura. “Driving cars, drifting, it’s so me, like it’s me, my hair, what I wear, my style, my personality,” Speed Sister Noor Daoud said in the film, brimming with joy. If you are as ecstatic as we are about the appeals court's decision to shutdown Trump's ban, celebrate by grabbing yourself a cocktail, popping some popcorn and streaming the Speed Sisters documentary on iTunes , or go see it in theaters starting today. You'll be as amped as we are about strong, persistent women. Check out the trailer:
